summary: Nikolay Sergeyevich Leonov was a KGB officer who was active in supporting Latin American revolutionary activities, particularly in Guatemala. He later became Chief of Service No. 1 (Information) of KGB Headquarters First (Foreign Intelligence) Directorate in Moscow. Documents also indicate his involvement in Soviet-Cuban relations, including connections with Fidel Castro. He was under surveillance in relation to these activities. One document mentions a suspected KGB officer in the Soviet Embassy in Mexico City, but the connection to Leonov is not explicitly stated.
significance: The significance of Nikolay Sergeyevich Leonov in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, his role as a KGB officer with connections to Cuba during the Cold War era could potentially link him to broader investigations into foreign involvement in the assassination.
